last_episode_to_air.name: Sometimes we feel a little self-conscious about our dumb sport
last_episode_to_air.overview: This is our stupid, violent spectacle sport for freaks and assholes that’s as legitimate as any other sport in the world. At least, it was ours at some point. The UFC has spent the 2010s sacrificing much of its magic in its desperation for mainstream legitimacy. This sport once transcended our world. Now, it is our world.

name: Fighting in the Age of Loneliness
original_name: Fighting in the Age of Loneliness
overview: Throughout its history, mixed martial arts have served as a refuge for people disillusioned and confounded by the world at large. People who just want to find some measure of escape within the honesty of primal combat, even if only for a few hours on a Saturday night. It’s no accident that the sport has become so massively popular in such a lonely time. “Fighting in the Age of Loneliness” is a five-part documentary series from SB Nation. It is written and narrated by Felix Biederman, and produced and directed by Jon Bois.
